_header: By a way wandering as I went / Sore I sighed sad
Note:
Number and order of stanzas varies (see Rigg (1968)
XRigg, A. George. Glastonbury Miscellany of the Fifteenth Century. Oxford, 1968, 55); see also 449.
_description: ’Thank God of All’ — up to seventeen 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, alliterative, with refrain, ‘thank God of all’

BodAsh343IX.First Lines:
By a way wandryg (sic) as I wentffor sorow sore I sykyt
                    sadde…
BodAsh343IX.Last Lines:
…Pore & ryche þat lowyþ to lowteAnd euer
                    þay þankyt haþ godof all

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
By a wandryng as y wentewell sore I sorowede for sykyng sadOf
                    harde happis þat I hadde hentmornyng me made almost
                    mad…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Ryche & pore þat lowe wyll lowteAlway þonk god
                    of al
BlCottCalAII.Note:
12 stanzas. Written two lines of verse per line of MS, with slash to
                    mark line break; ‘Explycyt’ by scribe in lower margin, f.
                        68v.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Þonke god of all (by scribe, upper margin, f. 68v);
                    Another: Thanke god for all (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents)
